debt_section:
NOTE 7 â€“ DEBT

The following table presents the Company's term debt as of September 30, 2023 and September 24, 2022:

                                                    2023         2022
Fixed-rate notes:
  2013-2022 issued notes                         $ 106,572    $ 111,824
  Commercial paper                                   5,985        9,982
    Total term debt                              $ 112,557    $ 121,806

As of September 30, 2023, the Company had outstanding floating-rate notes of $1.0 billion and fixed-rate notes of $105.6 billion.

The weighted-average interest rate on the Company's term debt was 3.52% as of September 30, 2023.

Debt Maturities:
2024                                            $ 10,791
2025                                              12,263
2026                                              11,970
2027                                               9,698
2028                                               7,792
Thereafter                                        60,043
    Total                                       $ 112,557

The Company maintains a $5.5 billion unsecured revolving credit facility. As of September 30, 2023, no amounts were drawn under this facility.
earnings_excerpt:
APPLE Q4 2023 EARNINGS CALL

Tim Cook, CEO: We're pleased to report revenue of $89.5 billion for the September quarter. iPhone revenue was $43.8 billion, and we set an all-time revenue record in Services of $22.3 billion.

Luca Maestri, CFO: We returned over $25 billion to shareholders during the quarter. Our net cash position was $51 billion. We expect December quarter revenue to be similar to last year.
